metadata.title: CVE-2022-0002 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - high
metadata.description:
Non-transparent sharing of branch predictor within a context in someIntel(R) Processors may allow an authorized user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0002` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-104-generic - 5.4.0-104.118
linux-image-5.4.0-104-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-104.118
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-104-generic - 5.4.0-104.118
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-104-lowlatency - 5.4.0-104.118
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-35-generic - 5.13.0-35.40~20.04.1
linux-image-5.13.0-35-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-35.40~20.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-104.118').
